title: Riot games employee's failing at their job.
body:
I was having an issue with purchasing Riot Points through the client a constant bug/error which was stopping me from making a transaction within the client store.

I was finally able to purchase riot points after a week of consistent issues/bugs/glitches of some kind, as I finally manage to get the riot points Challenger Ahri has been removed from the store. Now usually if you miss out you miss out, but the fact I was experiencing issues throughout that period, not being able to purchase riot points due to the client bugging. I now sit here without the skin.

I submit a ticket into riot games, asking for them to please allow me to buy the skin as I would have owned it had THEIR system not bugged out, had THEIR  system allowed me to purchase Riot points or make ANY transactions of any sort. Then I'd have the skin. I have spent over $3000 dollars on League of Legends, I'm a skin collector and have 489 skins and counting. Regardless to the fact I was having issues within the client to making any transactions, the amount I have spent ALONE should be enough for them to give leniency.

Their reply is as followed, "As much as I would like to be able to extend the Challenger Ahri sale to you, I am unfortunately not able to. It is against our policy to extend sales to individuals for any reason, as this would not be fair to other summoners. The only time we extend sales is after server downtime - so that everyone has a chance to catch the sale after the servers come back up. Extensions granted after downtime happen automatically within the game store."

I realize it's an unfair advantage towards other summoners as they wouldn't have the same privilege, but what you have to realize RIOT is it's a unfair advantage that I wasn't able to make any transactions within the client BECAUSE YOUR STUPID CLIENT WAS BUGGING.
How is that fair what's so ever to me that everyone else that wasn't haven't issue's of some sort were allowed to purchase the skin, yet I can't because your client is bugged?

People might sit here and probably think "this guys complains to much" or "you spent enough of the game" or "no one cares" but that's fine.
The point i'm trying to make is Riot Games wants to make a fair game for everyone, well then realize when you make mistakes and fix them. Instead of making people who PAY  your BILLS suffer.

#RIOTGives0FksAboutTheirCustomers

replies.body:
You should have made a support ticket back when you were having trouble purchasing Riot points in order to have the issue cleared up before Challenger Ahri left the store.


You had ample time to talk your problem out before the closing period.

I had a lot of family issue's going around at the time, and contacting Riot wasn't on my first Priority list, I had good reason to believe that the bug/issue would have been fixed much before a whole week.
Then it's your own fault. If you don't proactively work to fix your problem, then in the end when everything goes bad it ends up being entirely your own fault.

Wow dude, i feel for you (NOT) you had issues with your family its your fault, did you ever think to hit the repair button, it may take forever but at least it fixes all issues at that time, you do not deserve that skin if you're not gonna put in the effort

This is not Riot's fault in anyway, this yours for not trying to fix it yourself and anyway with harrowing, sugar rush and all that coming up likely that skin will make a reappearence contrary to Riot's it is here now gone to the vault once its over

Firstly I did try the repair button so don't make assumptions, secondly I was having issue's with the client 'store' no transactions were going through, I was still able to log in and play games, so the client it's self was okay, other then the client store bugging.

Take into consideration if you deposited 50'000 dollars into a bank, and the system bugged out and 25'000 was to randomly disappear, then you call the bank up to tell them there's an issue, and they reply with "sorry it's unfair if you give you back your money because it's unfair to other people" Yet it's the banks fault for having a bugged system.
Same situation just different scenario, Point is There was a client fault which made it impossible to make any transactions within the client, therefore Riot Games should be making it their best effort to fix the issue, and reimburse the customer which had a disadvantage.

I understand I had ample time to purchase the skin, but having the first part of the skins release having my bank account locked and the second part having the client bugging, made it impossible at any point to purchase the skin. The want to keep this completely fair to all summoners yet I summoner having a bug issue which is caused from Riots servers, or dodge coding is making a disadvantage to someone, therefore they should take leniency on that summoner.

I don't think it's unfair for you to get the skin.. I bought the skin when it first came out, I'm not going to be upset if someone else gets it now because their client wouldn't let them get RP..

Why is the skin limited time to begin with?
Well I'd assume it's going to be much like the Championship skins, 1 will be release per year, and never return to the store.
Championship Thresh came back for S4 worlds. They'll bring it back.

Get over it bro, you're not getting that skin and riot will not do what you ask, so let it go just be salty that you didn't get a skin and leave this game if this is such an issue, im sure DoTA will take you, you can join them in saltiness

My point being, I was at a disadvantage because the LoL client bugging, therefore that should give reason enough that Riot would allow such a transaction of buying the Ahri skins to be completed. Because had the client not been glitching or bugging for over a week, then I'd OWN the skin already.
Because I missed out because of a fault with the LoL client, I thought that was made clear?

The point of it is that the Riot games employee said 'it's an unfair advantage to other summoners' yet that's hypocritical as it's an unfair advantage to myself, for having client issues. If no bugs/issue's where involved and i missed out simply from not buying it then yeah badluck get over it, but the fact I was having client issue's stopping from making transaction is what makes this situation stupid.

I have had the same apalling service from Riot in the last week. after a number of e-mails, this was my last one from them ( sounds exactly likes yours suprize suprize) 

"Hello Summoner,
Energia here! I understand your frustration in wanting to purchase the Underworld Poro skin. However, as what my colleague have mentioned it was just probably a visual bug.
As much as I would like to extend the availability of the Underworld Poro ward skin to you, I am unfortunately not able to. It is against our policy to extend sales to individuals for any reason, as this would not be fair to other summoners. The only time we extend sales is after server downtime - so that everyone has a chance to catch the sale after the servers come back up. Extensions granted after downtime happen automatically within the game store.
I am very sorry about the inconvenience, but please let me know if there is anything else I can assist you with.
Energia
Riot Player Support "

THERE CLIENT! had the bugg that showed the poro skin over a week after it was suppose to be gone but yet I wasnt allowed to purchase it.

I can't see why this would be unfair for him to be able to purchase the skin. As he was having errors within the client so if he was unable to make any transactions work then theoretically he should be given the privilege of purchasing the skin. Put yourself in his shoes, where you are a skin collector and you make it your best effort to buy and own all skins, and you even have spent thousands upon thousands on the game, and you were having bugs/issues with the client. I'd surely imagine you would be pretty ticket off and the skin you needed/wanted so badly were to be taken away from you because you're unable to purchase it due to a client error?

Do you work for Riot?

Because if not I can't see any way that your title makes sense.
how is that an advantage. that's a disadvantage.
how is you missing out an unfair advantage to you?
tough luck, %%%% happens. guess what, stuff isn't always fair for everyone, get used to it.
but they said they won't put a skin back in the store or give it to one person, that's not their policy. why should they do it for you, and not the other possibly thousands of people that missed out?

I'm pretty sure you're just salty because you didn't get special treatment haha {{item:3070}}
